string-array.name: history_question
string-array.item: The first words spoken on the moon by Buzz Aldrin were these:
What U.S. President committed an unpardonable sin by kissing the Queen Mother on the lips?
Cleopatra was Egyptian.
The Rosetta Stone is the name of the limestone slab that became the key for deciphering ancient Egyptian hieroglyphics.
Prior to 1664 New York was called:
What are the surnames of Bonnie and Clyde?
Joan of Arc, in the 15th century, was the first female promoted to this rank in the French army:
In which year did William Shakespeare die?
On which island was Napoleon born?
Which states did the United States gain after the Mexican War?

string-array.name: science_nature_question
string-array.item: What is the layer of the earth underneath the crust called?
